text.p: Let [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline] be the subspace of [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^2[/mathjaxinline] drawn above. What is the dimension of [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline]?

font.p: If we take [mathjaxinline]v[/mathjaxinline] to be a vector of any length that lies in the direction of [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline], then the set of linear combinations of [mathjaxinline]v[/mathjaxinline] will be all of [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline]. Then, [mathjaxinline]\{ v\}[/mathjaxinline] is a linearly independent list that spans [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline], and thus [mathjaxinline]\{ v\}[/mathjaxinline] is a basis of [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline]. By definition, the dimension of [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline] is the number of vectors in any basis for [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline]. This is 1.
